str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To persist, insist, be more urgent. From epi and ischuo; to avail further, i.e. insist stoutly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shake up, stir up, excite. From ana and seio; figuratively, to excite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
